title: (UK) Are top university courses harder? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. Top graduate employers don't take 2.1 degrees from low ranking universities that seriously. They weed out graduates with good degrees from low ranking universities through the A level grading system. They say all applicants for their Big Job need A level grades that are xyz or better. This weeds out most graduates at the ex-polytechnics who got a 1st or 2:1.

Work loads tend to be heavy at the leading British universities, so in order to cope you need to be on top of your subject(s) and study skills, etc. For example, you are likely to have problems in Arts (Humanities) course at Oxbridge if you still find essay writing a problem. You also need to be good at organizing your time.
